page.title: 15LOCAL TRADE IN WEST WRATTING
page.content: {Shops and pubs:-} West Wratting has 1 small village shop cum post office. Besides a small selection of groceries and a post office counter the shop also provides a dry-cleaning service. There is just one public house in the village, the Chestnuts. {Businesses:- }The most important business in West Wratting is Spicer & Sons, coal merchants and haulage contractors.Mr Spicer started the coal business in 1929 with a horse and cart.In 1930 he bought his first lorry and started the haulage business in 1947. Today he owns 11 articulated lorries and 3 coal lorries, which he uses to deliver coal to surrounding villages.He employs 16 staff, half local. There is also an old man who repairs bicycles in his shed. {Deliveries:- }Baker,fishmonger,butcher milk and papers-none by local traders.
